RT @DrDrAbhiKole: 18 months into this pandemic, I was the first person to explain to my patient who is deaf and experiencing homelessness w…

“Just because something is complicated and difficult, we cannot ignore the patients and dismiss their suffering” - @VirusesImmunity 

ME/CFS patients have long been dismissed. I hope the attention on #LongCovid might help other chronic patients as well. https://t.co/HLBY4cHrXn
This is a good read for those interested in #LongCovid https://t.co/tWFTaqRn2O

I'm hearing more and more experts say this: Delta's changed the game, everyone will meet the virus at some point (that doesn't mean get sick or symptomatic, but at least carry it)

It makes sense to me scientifically, but GAH. Also let's speed the long Covid research please. https://t.co/jUHXsWW4AO

And why not have extra protection? The #CovidVaccine is great at lowering hospitalization risk, but I prefer not to get mild/long Covid as well.

Plus, maybe I'm wrong but I don't think the main motivator for getting vaxxed is "yay I don't have to wear a mask."

I don't understand the argument that mask mandates  discourage people from getting vaxxed.

As I see it, the vaccine protects *me* from severe Covid. Masks help protect *others* e.g. kids, immunocompromised + lower transmission rate so we can end this godawful pandemic sooner.
